transcription: I've got four circles drawn on my piece of plywood and I'm just going to cut those out with my skill saw.  four wooden blanks, one, two, three, four. You could, if you wanted to, put a nail in the middle and attach a string to your saw and use it as a compass to cut your circle.  But this seemed to work just fine. Alright, so I've got all four blanks here and they each have a two inch hole. And now I'm going to break them into two separate weights by putting some spacers in between them. So I just cut these six spacer blocks and I'm going to mount them in between my discs.  discs. So that's what my blank looks like. You can see it's got a little more stability than the standard single piece of plywood. And probably a little bit more weight. It's probably closer to 4 or 5 pounds than just one or two.
